comments:
I've created a server configuration for Tomcat 4.1.30.
After running it the first time a launch config has been created automatically
which I was able to manage so far (source-folders, additional libs, etc.).

But since 0.7M5 the launch configuration does not come up. It fails with a
NullPointerException (see below). I also deleted the launch-config and rerun the
server by what a new launch-config was created automatically; but the same problem.
Any other lunch-config can be managed and works as expected.

Since this problem exists debugging is a challenge as there are some missing
source-folders. The only workaround for this problem at the moment is editting
the launch-configs' xml-files.

I am using:
- Eclipse 3.1.0
- WTP-SDK 0.7 Release
- EMF-SDO-XSD-SDK 2.1.0
- GEF-SDK 3.1
- JEM-SDK 1.1


Session-data:
eclipse.buildId=I20050627-1435
java.version=1.5.0_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86


Exception when selecting a server-launch-config in the launch-config-dialog

The problem appears to be a server that no longer has an associated server type
(maybe an old server in your workspace?). I have fixed this bug and dropped code
for the next I-build.

(In reply to comment #1)
> The problem appears to be a server that no longer has an associated server type
> (maybe an old server in your workspace?). I have fixed this bug and dropped code
> for the next I-build.

To verify your assumption:
I deleted any servers and server-runtimes. Then I created a completely new
server-runtime (server-type=Apache Tomcat v4.1). Then I created a new server
referring to this new server-runtime. Started it, whereby a launch-config has
been created and the server came up properly.
But the problem is still the same. The recently created launch-config can not be
maintained.

I cannot reproduce. After creating a new server and running it once, the launch
configuration is created and I can start the server directly from the launch
configuration dialog. Have you deleted the old launch configuration and allowed
it to create a new launch configuration for your new server?

Since I cannot reproduce this bug I am closing it. If you still have a problem,
please reopen with step-by-step details on how to reproduce or the paste in the
error/exception you are seeing.
